c74object.name: entrymatcher~
c74object.digest: Flexible matching of multidimensional data at signal rate
c74object.description: entrymatcher~ is the audio rate counterpart of entrymatcher, capable of matching with sample-accurate timing. It is intended primarily for use in granular synthesis applications requiring sample accuracy for audio matching using descriptors. entrymatcher~ does not offer all the features of entrymatcher, and there are some key differences to the max version. 1 - entrymatcher~ takes values for matching at signal rate, and has a different message structure for setting matching criteria. 2 - entrymatcher~ randomly selects a value from all the valid matches and outputs only that one value. 3 - for reasons of efficiency the matching process and the randomisation processes can be triggered separately to allow variation over small time scales, without the expense of recalculating matches. 4 - only numeric data can be used (although entries and columns can still be referred to using symbols).

objarg.name: Max_entries
objarg.description: The first argument takes an int to set the maximum number of entries that entrymatcher~ will recognise. The default max entries is 1.

objarg.name: Number_of_columns
objarg.description: The second argument takes an int to set the number of columns allowed per entry. The default number of columns is 1

objarg.name: Number_of_test_inlets
objarg.digest: Set the number of test inlets
objarg.description: The third argument takes an int to set the number of test inlets to compared entries to. The default number of test inlets is 1

method.name: first-inlet
method.description:
A non-zero signal to the first inlet will trigger an output.
This output will be a randomly selected index of an entry that satisfies the matchers message and is not filtered out by the limit message.

method.name: second-inlet
method.description:
A non-zero signal to the second inlet will trigger a match.
This will cause entrymatcher~ to update to the latest selected matchers message and compare to the latest test value(s) in any inlet from the third onwards.

method.name: third-inlet
method.description:
The third inlet takes a signal value to be tested against each time a non-zero trigger signal is recieved in the second inlet.
Any further inlets (specified by the third argument) work the same as the third inlet. Using the matchers message, you may specify up to as many tests as you have created inputs for with the third argument to entrymatcher~. If no test is defined for an input then that input is ignored.

method.name: clear
method.description: The clear message clears all the currently stored entries and matchers. The reset message does the same.

method.name: entry
method.digest: Set the columns for each entry
method.description:
The entry message is used to send data into entrymatcher~ to be queried when the first inlet recieves a non-zero trigger signal.
The entry message should first contain a unique identifier (of any data type). The message should then contain a list with length equal to the columns argument in the entrymatcher~ object. The list should contain only numeric data.
An entry should be formatted as:
entry / identifier / list of numeric data
If a new entry is set with an identifier already in use, the old entry will be replaced.

method.name: labelmodes
method.digest: Set the labelmodes for each column
method.description:
The labelmodes message followed by a list of ints sets the labelmodes for each column. The list should have a length equal to the columns argument in the entrymatcher~ object.
The list should contain ints of either 0 or 1, where a 0 represents a numeric label, and a 1 represents a symbolic label for each column.
The message should be formatted as:
labelmodes / list of modes

method.name: limit
method.description:
The limit message by itself will result in no limiting, allowing all matches to output. This is the defualt mode.
You can limit the number of matched entries by either a maximum number as an int, or a ratio of valid matches to keep as a float(0-1) or by both. This is done using the limit message followed by the maximum number of matches to keep and then the ratio of matches to keep. Passing zero for either of these (or omitting a value) will turn that limit off. The closest (best) matches will be kept.

method.name: matchers
method.digest: Set the rules for entry matching
method.description:
The matchers message is used to set a number of tests that entries must satisfy. You may specify up to as many tests as you have created inputs for with the third argument to entrymatcher~. If no test is defined for an input then that input is ignored.
Some of the tests have a calculation that is used to find the distance. This distance value is then used to determine which values are closest and is used when the limit message filters out certain matches.
New matchers messages will not be recognised until a non-zero trigger signal has been input into the second inlet of entrymatcher~.
The message should be formatted as:
matchers / column identifier or number / test symbol or name / (repeat for multiple tests)
To see how matchers work and a list of all the symbols it accepts, see the second tab of the entrymatcher~ help file.

method.name: names
method.digest: Set the name for each column
method.description:
The names message followed by a list of symbols sets the names for each column. The list should have a length equal to the columns argument in the entrymatcher~ object.
The message should be formatted as:
names / list of names

method.name: open
method.description: The open message will open a table displaying all the contents of entrymatcher~. The colums are labelled as the index(#), identifier, and then the names set with the names message.

method.name: read
method.description: The read message will prompt you to open a new file, such as one written previously using the write message. The data in the new file will then replace the contents of entrymatcher~.

method.name: remove
method.description: The remove message followed by a symbol corresponding to an identifier will remove that item from entrymatcher~.

method.name: write
method.description: The write message will create a new file containing a dict of the contents inside entrymatcher~

attribute.name: embed
attribute.digest: Save the data with the patch
attribute.description: An int (0/off or 1/on) can be used to embed the data within the patch when the patch is saved.

entry.name: signal
entry.description: Outputs a signal representing the index of the chosen match. This output is randomly generated from any of the possible matched indexes every time a non-zero trigger signal is recieved in the first inlet.
